text: I am just guessing, but could be that they disabled opacity for emails because they want to keep it max compatibility possible? (instead rgba, hex)
Does rgba not work in email? Also there is other use cases other than just rgba

depends what is your target, but for example corporate nerworks use several different outlook versions and ... Â¡surprise! xD

Clicking the picker doesn't show an advanced tab?
There is an advanced tab. But no option for opacity
Yeah. Only if the template type email is selected though. Otherwise it's there
